definition: to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown

sentences.english: He responded to the customers' needs by innovating.
sentences.chinese: 他以创新来应抵泯灭者的需求。

sentences.english: Drift on water to certainly is in the life of a certain thing vanished.
sentences.chinese: 漂泊者的生命中一定有某种未泯灭的东西。

sentences.english: If you punish failure with disapproval, you diminish risk taking.
sentences.chinese: 如果你否决以惩失败，你就泯灭了冒险精神。

definition: to erase/to cover traces/to obliterate evidence/to expunge/to blot out/to suppress
to bury/to submerge/to pass into oblivion/to obliterate/to annihilate (physics)
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
(literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
to change into/to turn into/to become
(of dreams, hopes etc) to vanish/to evaporate/(of a person) to become disillusioned/disillusionment
